body: Does `rclone rmdirs C:/tmp` work for the same path?

> Does `rclone rmdirs C:/tmp` work for the same path?

Works as expected.

Ok, I'll pull out my windows machine and see if I can reproduce. If it's possible for you to include a debug log, that would be helpful (for example, to see how the arguments are getting translated to UNC paths at the beginning. Slashes on windows are notorious for causing trouble.)

> Ok, I'll pull out my windows machine and see if I can reproduce. If it's possible for you to include a debug log, that would be helpful (for example, to see how the arguments are getting translated to UNC paths at the beginning. Slashes on windows are notorious for causing trouble.)

Hey, I gave this a try tonight but wasn't able to reproduce it...it worked as expected for me. Are you able to post a debug log?

I tested again today. If the folder was created by PC1 and synced to PC2, when I make it empty, executing "remove empty dirs" will work on PC1 but give an error on PC2.
But sometimes it does work; still need time to confirm.

Does it only happen for directories created by a different PC? I wonder if that could be permission-related.

If you create the dir with `rclone mkdir` and then try to remove it with `rclone rmdir`, does that work?
Can't reproduce it anymore. I think it might be best to close it until a new problem shows up.

Reopening this as we've now likely identified the issue and a fix: https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-leaving-empty-directories-on-unc-path-1-or-local-filesystem-path-2-on-directory-renames/52456/4?u=nielash

issue.title: `local`: fix `rmdir` "Access is denied" on windows - fixes #8363

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Before this change, Rmdir (and other commands that rely on Rmdir) would fail with "Access is denied" on Windows, if the directory had FILE_ATTRIBUTE_READONLY. This could happen if, for example, an empty folder had a custom icon added via Windows Explorer's interface (Properties => Customize => Change Icon...). 

However, Microsoft docs indicate that "This attribute is not honored on directories."

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/fileio/file-attribute-constants#file_attribute_readonly

Accordingly, this created an odd situation where such directories were removable (by their owner) via File Explorer and the rd command, but not via rclone.

An upstream issue has been open since 2018, but has not yet resulted in a fix. https://github.com/golang/go/issues/26295

This change gets around the issue by doing os.Chmod on the dir and then retrying os.Remove. If the dir is not empty, this will still fail with "The directory is not empty."

A bisync user confirmed that it fixed their issue in https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-leaving-empty-directories-on-unc-path-1-or-local-filesystem-path-2-on-directory-renames/52456/4?u=nielash

It is likely also a fix for #8019, although @ncw is correct that Purge would be a more efficient solution in that particular scenario.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

- #8363 
- #8019 
- https://forum.rclone.org/t/bisync-leaving-empty-directories-on-unc-path-1-or-local-filesystem-path-2-on-directory-renames/52456/4?u=nielash
